documents.document:
Now all has changed

Guess what? I decided to add a little something to this post.

Okay, no. Guess what? Everything is changing around me!

Several things make me long for yesterday again . Seldom do we friends get to meet up as we had before , Sometimes( just sometimes) conversations run as dry as a well in the middle of a desert . There are moments of bliss where I can't help but have a grudge against the quiet slipping away of time . After all, didn't those memonts happen not too long ago?

Then again, I suppose I did expect this to happen . College life is exciting , yes, especially with the hilarious and great lecturers , and a whole bunch of wonderful people to be acquainted to . New friends enter my list , while old friends (or long lost ones) signed in again into my guest book . In short, I like this change . Here, it's as if we can be a different person, and the past matters not anymore.

Of course there are some downturns , such as a slightly bruised confidece , and lingering around me are ghosts haunting me from unhappy events of what was , but those I shall brush off my shoulder, overweighed by the sweet side of it.

"Yesterday is history ,
Tomorrow is a mystery ,
And today is a gift,
That's why it's called the present. "

I shall trust in this quote from Kungfu Panda . Have fun, guys.

Embarking Dreams

My road ahead is shrouded in mist. I'm not lost, no, perhaps not entirely. It's just that my map is but a piece of paper scribbled in my own tiny sketches . Part of me knows what I want, but sometimes the journey seems too far-fetched, sometimes it simply seems too far.

College, as I said, is awesome. At least I have not rolled out off the bed in the morning dreading the day, wishing I could roll back into la-la land . People whom I've acknowledged now as friends fill it with wonders. Ever heard of the cliche "It's a small world after all"? It's true here. No less keeping me sane are my family and past friendships. Thank goodness they are not left adrift.

Back to the journey. I'm now a Literature student , but oh how sometimes I feel unlike one. The lectures are interesting. The best thing about Lit? It's subjective, open to new ideas and debates, and you may see something no one saw and go euphoric! The scariest and hardest thing about Lit? It's subjective. You may write about something you believed earned you an A and yet got you grades so low that it's possible to reach the bottomless sea.

So far my grades are stagnant, though not such in a good way for me. The only tinge of hope being that My lit lecturer had told me how she felt I have the potential to do great but she does not see it on paper. Now with the grades I got so far, neither do I.

Right now I've given myself intensive Lit lessons, polishing my methods of answering. ..all I need now is to know if I'm going the right way. Wish me luck as I pay my Lit lecturer a visit tomorrow.

All I need to know is if the scribbles on my map can lead me through the mist.

All the best, guys, in embarking you dreams too.

Another best friend walking away

Just last year I wished a childhood best friend good bye as she left for Australia. It was quite an emotional week. I do miss her lots, but with technology (and she does return on holidays ), we do stay close.

Now I get a call from another best friend of mine whom I knew in high school and she's leaving as well. Albeit only a state away, it's a pretty strict institution so visiting may be almost nonexistant. And to even walk out on Saturdays and Sundays may require loads of paperwork.

I really am happy for her. She deserves this. After all, free education, with student allowance, and a sure guarentee of university? It takes a lot out of her mind and I'm thrilled as well.

Then again, she's leaving. Where she's going does not offer WiFi either, and hopefully she can find stalls which sell prepaid phone cards. In short, it will be VERY VERY hard to keep in touch.

Its not good bye, right? Just another "See you later".

Wishing my best friends all the best. We'll meet up some other day . That's a promise.

See you later. I guess

18th

Six months before and after Christmas. I've always found that term useful for making other people remembering an important date on my calender,

It's morning now and it's not the same as last year . Not that big a buzz . And after all, we did celebrate it on my chinese birthday . And I'll be working later ...not that I want to but she told me it was this Friday at first . I know this year is going to be different . I didn't think it would mean like this.

Oh well, as long as luck agrees to stick to me today , and I'll cherish those who remember , all will be well, right ?

Everywhere I go, every smile I see
I know you are there, smilin back at me.
Dancin' in moonlight. I know you are free.
Cause I can see your star shining down on me.

~Together Again, by Janet Jackson~

Rachael

Hit the roads by the book!

I've just had my first driving lesson! Of course it was in theory and not practical, just to be precise.

It was not bad, actually . What with the lecturer being extremely witty with his jokes. The thing was that the hours were so long no normal student could possibly stay awake through the entire class . And we knew only too well that with that time we have, we'd have to make haste with the lesson, which made it all that confusing.

While half the class (the half sitting more to the front, that is) were mostly attentive , quiet and ready to absorb it all in , the other half were in turmoil . Because we were late, our seats had to be the ones further to the back.

Why is it that every class must have this bunch of noisy boys taking the same course together? So insensitive as to make as much noise as possible , and imagine themselves capable to 'multitask' with one ear for the lecture , one ear for some music . Perhaps being so evolved a species, have one more to listen to their idle chit chat !

At least there were great people there.

All about the path ahead

Now that I'm back in college, something hit me hard . That is, apart from the fact that it's the most important semester of our course and that I must really put a lot of effort in it . It's all about the university applications these days.

That was how it became a frequent reminder that there is a mist shrouding the paths . I already have the dream , be it far-fetched as it may . I have a partial idea of what course I am interested in , and I know which country I want to go (and after all is the best choice for it anyway ). What I don't know is which institution to apply to.

If there's one thing I'm sure of , I'm not exactly Ivy League material . 3 or 4 A's for our college forecast? My stomach twisted into a knot the moment my ears caught that . My high school finals were pretty good , but such universities ask for nothing less than almost perfect .

Oh well. As long as I can have a course I want , freedom to travel about as I please, and an annual fee that won't put much of a burden on my parents , it's as good as being the best .

There was an introduction on UCAS University Application this afternoon , which is a great help to one like me. Hopefully my research which clear the mist away. And clear it fast, too.

Wish me luck.

Head in the clouds

I'm the kind of girl with my head stuck in the clouds. There are times when my mind drifts into a world parallel to ours , where there are heart-pounding adventures , dreamy castles and lands , beautiful music , blissful moments and happy-ever-afters .

Ever wondered why people love to watch Disney classics? Well, here I am, a Disney fan , enraptured by the thin line of fantasy of which it breaches , the numberless songs that ring in my ear and the lovely storylines .

I've always felt that life is a movie . Don't you think the same? For sometimes, we embark on our own escapade , we have little episodes in our daily lives that make us smile with all its wonders , or even the sudden burst of music to suit the moment .

Going to Disneyland set my spirit free . Apart from the summer heat , it was as good as flying into a whole new world . Suddenly it was the race around the park to explore every nook and corner of it. There's no need to feel awkward when people call it childish. Everyone does the same. There are many shows and rides that flows with nothing less than magic. And oh! The fireworks were amazing.

I'm the kind of girl with my head stuck in the clouds. Didn't I establish that?

And I'm loving every bit of the carefree, fantasy-like moment in the busy days of reality . I'm dreaming of story-like adventures and romance . It's alright if you call me a hopeless romantic , or simply childish.

Wouldn't you like your life to be a movie and be your own director?

At least, I would.

Some Cupids use Traps

There were four of us , you see, and we call ourselves 'Cupids' . We do not, however, fly about shooting arrows at unexpected couples . We do so to help a friend who thinks that her crush doesn't even know she exists.

The 'Cupid-affair' started with only three Cupids and the friend as mentioned . The fourth Cupid only joined us further down the road . Back then it was all innocent teasings . When we tell her that she should get to know him, her insecurities and fear spurts through her veins.

"Well, all I want is an opportunity." She sighed . With that fairy-godmother-like wish, we decided to take up the challenge .

Now to introduce the Cupids . There's the sentimental one , who sprinkles over her the romantic little notions she can think of . Then there's the bold one with her more colourful ideas , some flamboyantly exaggerating at times . Next there's the one who always seems to be buddies with the right people . Even the target himself. And then there's me...the one who eventually initiates the plans.

How easy it would be had we the quiver of arrows and the bow! Yet all we have are tricks up our sleeves. Though we've been in the stickiest of all sticky situations, it's a miracle how it remained silent to the target .

Though the plan is still in progress , we sincerely hope that it'll work! Of course, it all would come down to our friend in the end.

What do you think about playing Cupid? I suppose it's something worth remembering one day. And who knows what lies in the future?

Here's to a friend who must learn to be bold. And to all those afraid of the same thing. Remember that you either "dream the chase or chase the dream".

And here's to the Cupids who are working on the plan (perhaps you have some yourself) , and working with nothing but tricks and traps.

Love ala Uni

It's about time I sit down and think about which university to go to, which is not as easy as I thought.

I'm not the picky kind , so in the end I rounded down to two . But frankly I can't tell yet which would make me feel most happiest .

The first one was in fact the very first university I looked up. Almost like first love, won't you say? The offer's been given and it is a pretty good place to be in. The problem is that they are being so quiet that I can't get much information from them, not even when I send them emails to enquire. (Do not take the emoticons too seriously)

Then there is the second one, equally as prestigious . The town looks like a blast, and very artistically inclined. I had this tiny nudge telling me that I would have accepted it immediately if not that.... the offer they gave is not for what I applied for , although the course is similar in many ways.

I'm afraid that if I choose the second, I'll feel blue seeing that I can't get the course I want . Of course my friend said that if they gave another similar offer it is as good a signal. And yet the first does not send me brochures to coax me into it .

Does it sound like a love story to you? Well, love story in the context of unis , you can say. I'm not sure which to pick . How do I choose one over the other?

Nineteen.

Waking up on your birthday and realising you're already nineteen. Now that is what I call fast. It can be quite a shocker - where did all the teen years go? Where were those days when tiny mistakes didn't matter , and carefree days were ahead of us ? When the 'terrible teens' itself were an excuse to throw a fit ? And everything seemed to be going well?

And yet, amidst all the changes turning ninteen could have offered, the celebration had been very simple. The cutting of the cake was done during the weekend , so as to not clash with unfortunate paper I had to sit for on my birthday. The dinner was specially prepared and served for that purpose . On that day itself, the internet and my handphone were flooded with birthday wishes. I had a hearty meal with my friends and that...was just about it.

They like to tell me to enjoy what this year has to offer before I hit the 20s. (Oh! How daunting that sounds) Then again, I don't suppose it would matter much, would it?

"Age ain't nothing but a number, sometimes I have to wonder, what does it really mean..."
~Danny Gokey lyrics~



This time next year, however, I may very well be out of the country for studies. Maybe that counts for something. It'll be whole new experience, hopefully I will not be reminded that I'd be far away from my family, and there will be new possibilities to explore. That doesn't sound too bad, actually.

So here's a toast to being nineteen on this very year. May things become better and better with each passing day.

PS. I love these premium smilies!! I have them for a week. Thanks, PAN!

Thoughts before heading to the ball.

In about six more hours I will be heading off to our college ball. Not a new experience, if you consider my high school prom , yet I found myself in anxiety over what to wear or what to bring. Exams were over only on this week ; for most of us, preparation had to be crammed into two or three days .

I'm not the kind to dress up to the nines, and the heels still hurt because I haven't worn them since my uncle's wedding. I would be perfectly contented so long as I look presentable. (okay, I'm kidding with the animation)

It would also mark the night my friends and I move on to our respective roads. Yesterday they organised a surprise celebration for me and a friend , although I did suspect something amiss on the way there. How sweet of them!! We sang our hearts out during our karaoke session and I know I will miss them so much . And to think that after tonight, the next time we meet could very well only be in a year's time.

I've got to go now. Well, I really do hope that tonight will be simply amazing. So that I have another lovely memory to keep with me wherever I go.

Wherever I go...
